text:
June 8, 1962
Hr* James S. Miles, Director
WBAA Radio-TV, Hall of Music,
Purdue University,
Lafayette, Ind*
Dear Jim!
Conversations at the Region III meting in Muncie and others conducted
by WHOM*a Music Director Harry Welliver during a recent tour of midwest
educational stations, seem to indicate considerable Interest in a
meeting to discuss general problems of music programming on educational
stations* Accordingly, WHOM is making plans to hold such a meeting in
Ann Arbor, under University of Michigan auspices* Jfasic directors or
station staff most directly concerned with programming music will be
invited* If we do not receive a sufficient number of firm acceptances
to attend, we will cancel the meeting* NAEB member stations in Region III
will be the principal invitees*
We have tentatively scheduled the meetings from noon to noon of November
6 and 7* This will get us away from football weekends, and the NAEB
convention* Do you know of any other broadcasting activity, particularly
concerning educational radio or NABB, with which we might be in conflict?
Would it be appropriate for us to announce that the meetings are being
held in cooperation with NABB? We are not requesting NAEB sponsorship
or funds* If the conference is successful, however, we hope to make
a transcript of the proceedings which should be of benefit to all
member stations*
I am sending a copy of this letter to Harold Hill and trust he will
comment as well* Any suggestions, recommendations, or even outcries of
horror, will be given the usual careful consideration*
Cordially,
E.G* Burrows
Manager, WUOM
